stories.headline: DATA ACCESS Year after attacks files still guarded
stories.author_title: Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press
stories.summary: Explores the reversal of government data access post-9/11, with agencies restricting data citing security, affecting journalists' ability to access information.

stories.headline: Databases add depth to school stories
stories.summary: Discusses the importance of computer-assisted reporting in covering the education beat, highlighting the impact of the No Child Left Behind Act.

stories.headline: Data shows cronyism in schools
stories.summary: Investigates how taxpayer dollars in Miami-Dade schools are benefiting lobbyists and contractors rather than students, highlighting cronyism.

stories.headline: Building a database for tracking state money
stories.summary: Details the creation of a database for analyzing state political contributions and expenditures, revealing the role of soft money in state politics.

stories.headline: Uncovering back-door vouchers
stories.summary: Investigates Pennsylvania's tax credit program that secretly funds religious schools, reflecting the role of tax credits in educational finance.

stories.headline: Measuring long bus rides for rural children
stories.summary: Analyzes bus ride durations for rural West Virginia children, revealing excessive commute times due to school consolidations.
